Margaret

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, <JeremyRobertHuber@...> wrote:
>
> If anyone in this group lives near Arkansas you can go dig crystals and get them free. All 
we had to pay was a digging fee which was, then, just a few dollars. It may of gone up by 
now. This was in the early 90's when my (first) wife and I went a couple of times to Hot 
Springs, Arkansas to dig crystals. At that time I lived in Texas (I am originally from 
Oklahoma), so it was about a four hour drive from Dallas.
> 
> We had a wonderful time and found a plethora of beautiful crystals. Even some sizable 
clusters. The energy of the crystals is very strong when you bring them out of the dirt as 
they have been in Mother Earth their whole lives. They have a rust color appearance and 
they have to be soaked in the solution that you use to clean pools. I would say all in all 
each trip we netted about ten pounds or so of crystals. 
> 
> 
> Also, if any of you like to camp there are numerous wonderful state parks in that area 
that have very nice camping facilities, plus even some cabins and shelters. The lakes there 
are crystal clear and you can see to the bottom. We found Lake De Grey the most beautiful 
of the ones in that area that we visited.
> 
> I hope this helps.
> 
> Many Blessings All,
> 
> Jeremy 
> New York, New York
>
